snippet: President Vladimir V. Putin of Russia said he was reversing what he described as a historical mistake, declaring, “Crimea has always been an integral part of Russia in the hearts and minds of people.”
abstract: Russian Pres Vladimir V Putin reclaims Crimea as a part of Russia, reversing what he describes as a historic injustice; makes clear in emotional address steeped in years of resentment over perceived slights from the West that he is righting an injustice inflicted by Soviet Union 60 years ago, brushing aside international condemnation that could leave Russia isolated for years to come.

byline.original: By STEVEN LEE MYERS and ELLEN BARRY
byline.contributor: Reporting was contributed by Alan Cowell from London; David M. Herszenhorn from Simferopol, Ukraine; Andrew Higgins from Brussels; Peter Baker from Washington; Andrew E. Kramer from Kiev, Ukraine; Alison Smale and Melissa Eddy from Berlin; and Mark Landler from Warsaw.

lead_paragraph: President Vladimir V. Putin of Russia said he was reversing what he described as a historical mistake, declaring, “Crimea has always been an integral part of Russia in the hearts and minds of people.”

headline.sub: Cites Centuries of History in Signing Annexation Treaty
headline.main: Putin Reclaims Crimea for Russia and Bitterly Denounces the West
headline.print_headline: Putin Reclaims Crimea for Russia and Bitterly Denounces the West
